medical_history.chief_complaint: Patients exhibited symptoms of superior canal dehiscence syndrome (SCDS) including hearing loss, aural fullness, disequilibrium, and sensitivity to sound.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms varied by patient with reports of episodic disequilibrium for over 15 years in one patient and other symptoms developing over several years. Factors exacerbating symptoms included straining and exposure to loud sounds.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Medical histories of the patients include migraine, hypertension, and gastroesophageal reflux disease for some individuals. Otherwise, many had unremarkable medical histories.
medical_history.family_history: At least two first-degree relatives in multiple families exhibited similar symptoms consistent with SCDS, suggesting a potential genetic predisposition.
